title: 447. How Much Do We Really Care About Children?
description: They can’t vote or hire lobbyists. The policies we create to help them aren’t always so helpful. Consider the car seat: parents hate it, the safety data are unconvincing, and new evidence suggests an unintended consequence that is as anti-child as it gets.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
